content.question: The diagram above illustrates how the reaction <math alttext="N 2 gas plus 3 H 2 gas react to produce 2 N H 3 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.250em"></mspace><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.250em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> occurs on the surface of <math alttext="R u solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>Ru</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The rate of this reaction is determined by the amount of energy required to break the bond in <math alttext="N 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. This bond is weakened when <math alttext="N 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is adsorbed on <math alttext="R u solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>Ru</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on this information, which of the following provides the best reason for the use of <math alttext="R u solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>Ru</mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for the synthesis of <math alttext="N H 3 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: It promotes the proper orientation of <math alttext="N" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms to form new <math alttext="N H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> bonds.
It provides a reaction path with a lower activation energy.

It forms a bond between <math alttext="R u" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Ru</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> that is stronger than the bond in <math alttext="N 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

It decreases the frequency of collisions between <math alttext="N 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H 2 gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: It provides a reaction path with a lower activation energy.

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
